title: Baked Flan Recipe
description: This flan is baked in a water bath to achieve a deliciously silky texture. It's quick and easy to prepare in a blender, and great served warm or cold.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Custards and Puddings Flan Recipes Baked Flan 4.7 (514) 421 Reviews 117 Photos This baked flan recipe is quick and easy to prepare in the blender. It's great served warm or cold and has a delicate creamy texture like custard. Slice the flan and spoon a little of the melted sugar onto the top of each slice. Submitted by Beth Updated on September 1, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 117 117 117 117 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings ⅔ cup white sugar 2 cups heavy cream 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 5 large eggs 1 cup milk 2 teaspoons vanilla extract Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat sugar in a small nonstick saucepan over medium heat until completely dissolved; shake and swirl the pan until sugar has caramelized and is a dark golden brown color; pour into a 1 1/2-quart baking dish, and swirl to coat the bottom of the dish evenly. Combine cream, condensed milk, eggs, milk, and vanilla in a blender; blend on high for one minute. Pour mixture over caramelized sugar. Place the baking dish into a deep roasting pan; pour in enough boiling water to come 1 inch up the sides of the dish. Bake in preheated oven until flan is set, 50 to 60 minutes. I Made It Print 1,027 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. Add Your Photo Photos of Baked Flan 01 of 117 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 117 Photo by  kronic22 04/05/2023 Great recipe. Perfect as written.Try sprinkling flavors like instant coffee, cocoa, cinnamon on the baking dish BEFORE the melted sugar. Adds a hint of flavor to the caramel. The coffee is my favorite.You can also add coffee to the custard in the blender, or substitute flavored milk (use less sweetened condensed milk).My oven's top elements went bad in the middle of cooking this one (pictured) and I had to finish it at my neighbors. Still turned out fine, very forgiving recipe.Great recipe! 03 of 117 Photo by  Luv Locks 07/08/2022 I made it to the recipe and added mango and coconut it is so good 04 of 117 Photo by  PoliteTimer3526 04/04/2022 Reminded me of my childhood. Loved it!! I hand mixed the ingredients instead like the way my grandma would. Turned out amazing!! 10/10 would recommend 05 of 117 Photo by  Zach Stotter 06/12/2021 06 of 117 Photo by  Harry Quintana 04/21/2021 07 of 117 Photo by  Harry Quintana 04/21/2021 08 of 117 Photo by  martin 12/13/2020 09 of 117 Photo by  Dayan Gonzalez 11/05/2020 Great recipe just and small suggestion to substitute the milk for evaporate milk because is more rich in flavor than regular milk. 10 of 117 Photo by  AppleButterball 08/18/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Flan de Queso (Cream Cheese Flan) 64 Ratings Creamy Caramel Flan 705 Ratings Caramel-Glazed Flan 119 Ratings Super Easy Cream Cheese Flan 5 Ratings Pumpkin Flan Coconut Milk Flan 17 Ratings Coconut Flan 50 Ratings Flan de Coco (Coconut Flan) 128 Ratings Microwave Flan 25 Ratings White Chocolate Flan 4 Ratings Aracely's Flan 40 Ratings 7 Absolutely Irresistible Mexican Flan Recipes Sous Vide Flan 12 Ratings Quesillo (Venezuelan Flan) 6 Ratings Brazilian Style Flan (Pudim de Leite Condensado) 37 Ratings Simple and Creamy Spanish Flan 9 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Beth
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Heat sugar in a small nonstick saucepan over medium heat until completely dissolved; shake and swirl the pan until sugar has caramelized and is a dark golden brown color; pour into a 1 1/2-quart baking dish, and swirl to coat the bottom of the dish evenly.;Combine cream, condensed milk, eggs, milk, and vanilla in a blender; blend on high for one minute. Pour mixture over caramelized sugar.;Place the baking dish into a deep roasting pan; pour in enough boiling water to come 1 inch up the sides of the dish.;Bake in preheated oven until flan is set, 50 to 60 minutes.
